Common causes of roof damage include: exposure to harsh sunlight (overmuch), strong winds, hail, debris from trees or plants, snow accumulation, standing water and improper maintenance.

Abrasion from these critters can lead to punctures and cracks in shingles as well as other materials used for roofs like metal or slate. Additionally, if too much heat builds up around the attic area it will ultimately cause the components of your roof to expand resulting in further damage.

Moreover, times come when people don't pay heed to the changing environment around their home which may lead to further deterioration of their roofs over time. For instance; if you live in an area where heavy storms occur frequently then you need to keep an eye out for any falling branches or tree limbs that could potentially land on your roof causing serious harm.

In order to avoid these common causes of roof damage and degradation one must take proper precautions such as inspecting their roofs regularly (yearly), removing debris such as leaves and twigs regularly and making sure they have sufficient insulation installed around their attics so that no excessive heat builds up inside during summer months. Also sealing any cracks or openings with quality sealants is highly recommended! By following these steps you will be able to have a durable and long-lasting roof for many years to come!

Moreover, it's important to ensure that your roof has proper ventilation. Without adequate airflow through the attic space, condensation can build up which can lead to water damage and rot in the long run. It's also beneficial to create an insulation barrier between the interior of your home and the roof itself; this will help keep things cooler in summer months and warmer during wintertime.

Furthermore, regular inspections should be conducted by a professional contractor on at least an annual basis. During these checks any potential problems with the material or installation can be identified before they become more serious issues down the road! Thus investing in quality building materials is key for not only having a strong yet beautiful roof but also saving money on costly repair bills later on down the line! Second, remove leafs and other debris from the gutters regularly so that water can flow freely away from the house! Third, check for any weakened spots on the roof after a severe storm or harsh winter; if any are found have them repaired promptly!
